intro: Parasenecio chola, commonly known as the Chola groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and grasslands. It has lance-shaped leaves with rough textures and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native region.
